newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Sunrise shareholder trims stake in firm.
newsitem.headline: Sunrise shareholder trims stake in firm.

text.p: The executive chairman of property developer Sunrise Bhd, Alan Tong Kok Mau, said he has trimmed his equity stake in the company by selling 26 million shares for 227.5 million ringgit.
In a Thursday notification to Sunrise, Tong said his private firm Sunrise Holdings Sdn Bhd had cut its stake in the listed company to 18.58 percent from 51.08 percent.
The sale reduced the private company's stake in Sunrise to 14.87 million from 40.87 million.
The notice did not say who bought the 26 million shares, which comprises 32.5 percent of the issued and paid-up capital of Sunrise.
In a separate statement, Econstates Bhd said it has acquired 8.0 million Sunrise shares through a local stockbroker at 8.75 ringgit a share or a total of 70 million ringgit.
The acquisition, which comprises 10 percent of Sunrise's issued capital, will be paid by bank borrowings, Econstates said.
